college.translation[0].definitions[0].de: a school for advanced education, especially in a particular profession or skill
college.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: Donna left school and went to art college.
We were great friends when we were at college.
college.translation[0].definitions[1].de: a large school where you can study after high school and get a degree
college.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Some people who want to go to college still can’t get there.
a decline in the number of college students studying history
Fran just finished her freshman year in college.
college.translation[0].definitions[2].de: one of the groups of teachers and students that form a separate part of some universities, especially in Britain
college.translation[0].definitions[3].de: the students and teachers of one of these organizations
college.translation[0].definitions[3].no: In this meaning, college is usually followed by a singular verb
The college is putting on a production of ‘Twelfth Night’
The college are putting on a production of ‘Twelfth Night’
college.translation[0].definitions[4].de: a group of people who have special rights, duties, or powers within a profession or organization
college.translation[0].definitions[5].de: a word used in the name of some large schools, especially public schools
college.translation[0].note_box[0].secti: After university I went to drama college for a year.
He was the first person in his family to attend college.
What are you going to do when you finish art college?
The Music College was founded in 1869.
I wanted a job in farm management so I went to agricultural college.
